ai.summary: Mosses Trail Green is a short, easy 4.3 km hike in the UK, offering a gentle stroll through moss-friendly woodland. Suitable for beginners and families, with light elevation and well-marked paths.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly well-maintained forest paths with gentle ascents. Expect damp, moss-covered sections and occasional roots near the trail edges; some stretches may be uneven.
ai.safety_notes: General safety: wear sturdy footwear and use the marked trails. Check the weather and daylight hours before you go; inform someone of your plan. In damp conditions moss can be slippery, so take care on shaded sections and watch for roots and uneven ground. Bring water, a small first aid kit, and a phone with emergency contacts; follow local guidance on dogs and wildlife.
recommended_gear: Map or offline GPS / trail app
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn; winter hiking is possible with proper gear but may be muddy or icy.
